item.title: Top of
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Yes. There’s 3 differnt ways you can comment.

[SCAR]// A single line comment is started by the two slashes.

{ This is a multi
Line comment, you can use
it for however many lines
you want to. Don’t forget
then end bracket! }

(* This isnt a very common way of commenting,
but it does work. This is also a multi-line
comment. Again, dont forget the end
comment piece that looks like this: *)[/SCAR]

You can use any of those, as long as you use them right. Not like its easy to use them wrong, lol.

EDIT: Hmm, I never knew the (* *) comment didn’t show up in the SCAR Tags, but they do work!

Read full topic

item.title: Top of
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Do this before your first /

{

and do this after your last slash

}

Now all of this should be before…

Program your_program_name;

etc etc[br][size=1]Posted at: October 09, 2006, 07:50:23 AM[/size][hr]Here is a code sample that works.

{//////////////////////////////////
//////    M0rtions Script©   //////
/////  -*************-     ////////
///////////////////////////////////
/////////  Instructions   /////////
//.Start In A Area With Lots Of  //
// **** Respawn/Are Left         //
// No Items In Inventory{Setup}  //
// 3 items Or Less Incase Death  //
// V-Bright, 32 Bit Color        //
//////////////////////////////////}

program New;
begin
end.

It works without the { and the } but I just put it in because a lot of people like to use those incase they forget to comment about 1 or 2 lines.

Read full topic
